title: 104_hr2635
content: Fair Elections Act - Establishes the Fair Elections Commission to study and recommend reforms in the laws relating to elections for Congress. Sets forth as the primary objectives of the Commission: (1) encouraging fair and open congressional elections that provide voters with meaningful information about candidates and issues. (2) eliminating the disproportionate influence of special interest financing of congressional elections. And (3) creating a system in which incumbent Members of Congress do not possess an inherent advantage over challengers. Sets forth fast-track procedures for consideration of such reform legislation. Authorizes appropriations.
